comments:
Abolished 25.3.1898 and added to the parish of Bradford. 
    See also Table 2, notes (a) and (c).

Created 1894 from the part of the parish of Calverley with Farsley 
    in Calverley Urban District. Abolished 1.4.1937 and added to the parish 
    of Pudsey.
Abolished 1894 to become the separate parishes of Calverley, Farsley and Thornbury. See also Table 2, note (a).
See Table 2, notes (b) and (e).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (h).

Created 1894 from the part of the parish of Thornton in Denholme 
    Urban District. See also Table 2, note (f).

Abolished 1.4.1937 and added to the parish of Morley. See 
    also Table 2, notes (a) and (h).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (e).

Created 1894 from the part of the parish of Calverley with Farsley 
    in Farsley Urban District. Abolished 1.4.1937 and added to the parish of 
    Pudsey.

Abolished 25.3.1898 and added to the parish of Bradford. 
    See also Table 2, notes (a) and (c).

Abolished 1.4.1937 and added to the parish of Cleckheaton. 
    See also Table 2, note (a).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (e).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (e).
See Table 2, notes (a), (g) and (i).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (f).

Created 1894 from the part of the parish of Calverley with Farsley 
    in Bradford County Borough. Abolished 25.3.1898 and added to the parish 
    of Bradford. See also Table 2, note (c).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (e).
See Table 2, notes (a) and (e).

Created 1894 from the part of the parish of Pudsey in Bradford 
    County Borough. Abolished 25.3.1898 and added to the parish of Bradford. 
    See also Table 2, note (c).

Abolished 1.4.1938 and added to the parish of Bingley. See 
    also Table 2, notes (a) and (f).
See Table 2, notes (a), (d) and (e).

That part which until 1.4.1938 formed the parish of Wilsden. See 
    also Table 2, note (f).

That part which until 25.3.1898 formed parts of the parishes 
    of Allerton, Heaton, Thornbury and Tyersall. See also Table 2, note (c).

That part which until 1.4.1937 formed the parish of 
    Drighlington. See also Table 2, note (h).

That part which until 1894 formed part of the parish of Clayton. 
    See also Table 2, note (b).
